description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2rq9b","text":"Nuclei dissociation protocol adapted from WU sn-prep Protocol for Solid Tumors - snRNA protocol v2.8 for simultaneous profiling of genetic expression (snRNA) and chromatin accessibility (snATAC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8je4e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eldor","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"72hb1","text":"1x Lysis buffer (2mL):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ojgv","text":"10mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.4) (Thermo; 15567027), 20μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbt2j","text":"10mM NaCl (Thermo; AM9759), 4μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duseg","text":"3 mM MgCl2 (Thermo; AM9530G), 6μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm9v7","text":"NP-40 substitute (Sigma, 74385-1L), 2μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbvnl","text":"1 M DTT (Sigma, 646563), 2μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pqnq","text":"Nuclease Free Water (Invitrogen, AM9937), 1.966mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m3ja","text":"0.1x Lysis Buffer (10mL):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvm0m","text":"1x Lysis Buffer (1mL) + Lysis Dilution Buffer (9mL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ada8","text":"Wash and Resuspension buffer (WR buffer, 10mL):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkfs2","text":"1X PBS, 8mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74f69","text":"10% Stock BSA Solution (MACS, 130-091-376), 2mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1kg4f","text":"Trypan blue (2X) - filtered at 0.22μm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"35f1u","text":"If using frozen tissue sample, use a scalpel (aided by a pair of fine forceps) to cut the cold samples (25-35mg) into 2mm pieces, add 1 ml of ice-cold 0.1X lysis buffer and 30 μL RNase Inhibitor, load into the glass homogenizer. Homogenize with 4-6 push/pulls using the pestel, incubate on ice for 1 min with an additional 500-1000μL of 0.1X cold lysis buffer. Pipette gently for 4 times. Incubate on ice again for up to 1 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nip0","text":"Keep everything on ice (or in the cold room)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqls3","text":"Use RNase free reagents and consumables, before starting wipe down all surfaces/pipettes with RNase away and 70% ethanol ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1evlp","text":"Avoid foam and bubbles as much as possible with gentle strokes and pipetting slowly","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c69rl","text":"7-AAD (7-Aminoactinomycin D) (Millipore Sigma SML1633-1ML)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"k96n","text":"Glass homogenizers (Fisher: 2mL tube- K8853030002, Small clearance pestle- K8853020002, Large clearance pestle- K8853010002)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9um2v","text":"Fine forceps and scalpels","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"er55t","text":"Roche Protector RNase inhibitor-2000 U/μL (Millipore Sigma 3335399001)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9b1r7","text":"If using pulverized powder, start with 15-35 mg total, add 1 ml of ice-cold 0.1X lysis buffer and 30 μL RNase Inhibitor, pipette the powder/lysis buffer mix gently for 6-8 times. Let sit on ice for 30”. Pipette another 4-6 times with an additional 500-1000μL of 0.1X cold lysis buffer. Incubate on ice again for 1’ – could be reduced (to like 20-45”). Add to the glass homogenizer, use the pestle for 3-4 push/pulls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bjftd","text":"If using OCT sections, start with 300-450μm total sectioned into a 1.5mL tube. Add 1 ml of ice-cold 0.1X lysis buffer and 30 μL RNase Inhibitor, pipette the mix gently for 10-12 times, will be sticky as the OCT thaws. Let sit on ice for 30”. Pipette another 4-6 times with an additional 500-1000μL of 0.1X cold lysis buffer. Incubate on ice again for 1’ – could be reduced (to like 20-45”). Add to the glass homogenizer, dounce with the pestle for 6-8 push/pulls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"639mi","text":"Filter the homogenate through a 40μM cell strainer on ice on top of a 50ml conical tube. Wash the filter with 1ml WR buffer. Collect this into the same tube, the total filtrate is ~3 ml. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvkq6","text":"If there is still tissue on the strainer, backwash with 2 mL 0.1x Lysis buffer, follow previous steps again to dissociate completely. If going to FACS with the backwash, proceed with this sample as if it were a different tissue but sort into same collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"96phh","text":"Transfer the filtrate to a 5ml Eppendorf tube. Centrifuge at 500g for 6’ at 4°C, resuspend with 100-400μL WR buffer (depending on pellet size) and 10 μL RNase inhibitor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6shd","text":"Transfer into a FACS sorting tube and add 3μL 7-AAD per 500 μL of resuspended sample, incubate for 10 minutes before sorting at FACS. After resuspending sample in wash buffer, if small chunks are still visible (after ~3 minutes of resuspension) use 40μM mini-strainer over FACS tube to remove chunks (proceeding to FACS with sample in current condition will clog machine and will result in additional lost sample).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cv4oq","text":"Add 50μL 10% BSA solution and 10μL RNase inhibitor and into a 2mL nonbinding tube for collection. Sort 300-400K of the nuclei into the collection tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ck93","text":"After FACS sorting is done centrifuge the 2ml collection tube at 500g for 6’ at 4°C. There will not be a visible pellet, remove all the supernatant (likely ~3μL will be left).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9hter","text":"Resuspend in 3μL 2x Nuclei Dilution Buffer (prepared as directed by 10x Genomics, pg. 28) and 1μL RNase inhibitor, final volume should be ~10μL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3kp6","text":"Quantify nuclei quality and quantity using a hemacytometer or Countess II utilizing Trypan blue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5c34n","text":"Load desired concentration of nuclei, proceed with the protocol as outlined by 10x Genomics which can be found here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":111,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9727ABA02BF711EEAA4E85038409F1A3","url":"https://cdn.10xgenomics.com/image/upload/v1666737555/support-documents/CG000338_ChromiumNextGEM_Multiome_ATAC_GEX_User_Guide_RevF.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87q6f","text":"Lysis Dilution Buffer (10mL):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fiml5","text":"10mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.4) (Thermo; 15567027), 100μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76rsc","text":"10mM NaCl (Thermo; AM9759), 20μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u38b","text":"3 mM MgCl2 (Thermo; AM9530G), 30μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1meh6","text":"1 M DTT (Sigma, 646563), 10μL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a29vd","text":"Nuclease Free Water (Invitrogen, AM9937), 9.840mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: WU sn-prep Protocol for solid tumors- joint snRNA+ATAC v2.9
